arcs.Name: Benizakura Arc
arcs.Description: The Yorozuya receive two jobs: Namely to search for Katsura as requested by Elizabeth and, additionally, to recover a dangerous blade known as Benizakura for the blacksmith Tetsuya. Although, as the Yorozuya start to bump into each other more and more while attempting to solve these two (seemingly) unrelated cases, it becomes clear that there's more to both requests than they had been led to believe.

arcs.Name: Host Club Arc
arcs.Description: At the Takamagahara, Kyoushirou decided to quit his job as a host to open a plastic model shop, and the Yorozuya would be his last customer. As the Yorozuya disapproved of his decision, Hachirou told them about Madam Yagami - a rich woman who has the power to never visit a town twice. However, after visiting Takamagahara, she left, saying that she would return next week. However, as she is not known for interfering nor being intimate with any shops, her return would bring disasters for the Kabuki District.

arcs.Name: Frozen Time Arc
arcs.Description: The Yorozuya find themselves trapped in a world frozen in time, thanks to an Amanto clock that Gintoki accidentally broke. They must figure out how to free themselves, help some characters, and take advantage of their new position. But problems, as usual, arise.

arcs.Name: Feigned Illness Arc
arcs.Description: On a hot, boiling day, Gin-san and Shinpachi make light of a forgotten plot element revolving around Kagura and the Yato. As a result, Kagura ends up at the hospital... and finds it a good opportunity to teach them a lesson.

arcs.Name: Umibozu Arc
arcs.Description: Umibozu Arc is the fifth arc in Gintama. It introduces Kagura's Yato father, Umibouzu.

arcs.Name: Shinsengumi Crisis Arc
arcs.Description: Hijikata receives a cursed sword that causes him to act strangely, putting his position in danger. At the same time, Shinsengumi adviser Itou Kamotarou returns to the Shinsengumi to push it forward, but Hijikata suspects something more is going on.

arcs.Name: Tama Quest Arc
arcs.Description: Tama Quest Arc is the 27th arc in Gintama.

arcs.Name: Diviner Arc
arcs.Description: Ketsuno Ana, the girl who gives the weather on television, and a person whom Gintoki admires, has begun to have bad weather forecasts and people are beginning to complain about the situation. One morning Yoroyuza receives a visit from her who asks them to help find those responsible for these phenomena and Yoroyuza accepts however after being attacked by a squadron of giant and astonished demons look like Ketsuno Ana confronts them with talismans and removed, revealing it is an Onmyoji and this is all a conspiracy by another Onmyoji to resurrect a great evil, for it asks them to go to visit his family and stop the demonic you were starting to emerge in the city. Thus the Yoroyuza will be involved with the world of onmyoji and demons.

arcs.Name: Vacation Arc
arcs.Description: The Shinsengumi are stuck with a vacation, but the true purpose behind it was to be the Shogun's escorts for his ski trip. At the very place, they bump heads with the Yorozuya, and as you may have guessed, trouble arises for the party in the world of snow!

arcs.Name: Shinigami Arc
arcs.Description: While a phantom killer had been targeting drunkards on the streets, a drunk Sakata Gintoki went home, only to see a Shinigami asking him to help it committing seppuku. Unfortunately, he ended up beating the Shinigami unconscious and brought it home. At the Yorozuya, the shinigami turned out to be a girl named Ikeda Asaemon.

arcs.Name: Mother Arc
arcs.Description: Mother Arc is the 10th arc in Gintama. It introduces Honjou Kyoushirou, Hachirou and Katsuo.

arcs.Name: Kagura's Boyfriend Arc
arcs.Description: Kagura has a boyfriend!! What unspeakable things will happen to him who appears before the obsessively nosey, restlessly agitated Umibozu and Gintoki !?

arcs.Name: Rokkaku Arc
arcs.Description: Okita is attacked by a girl who claims that her father was murdered by him during the Rokkaku massacre years ago. The incident is brought back to the surface to uncover the truth.

arcs.Name: Jail Arc
arcs.Description: In a place that offers "Jail Play" entertainment, the Yorozuya are asked to apprehend a non-paying pervert. But doing such a thing somehow lands Gintoki a place in the slammers!

arcs.Name: Love Potion Arc
arcs.Description: Yoshiwara is besieged by a mysterious incense that has the ability to make whoever smell it fall for the first person they see; poor Tsukuyo is hit, her already secret attraction with Gintoki intensified. In trying to gather the incense, Tsukuyo's slip-up causes the entire district to be affected by the smoke, including the Yorozuya (and Tae, Kyuubei, and Kondou who happened to be there at the time). Can the Yorozuya and Tsukuyo overcome their afflictions to stop the perpetrator?

arcs.Name: Excalibur Arc
arcs.Description: The Yorozuya visits Tetsuko's blacksmith shop to resharpen Otose's husband's sword for his death anniversary. While there, they stumble across a sword Amanto who asks for their help in finding his scabbard wife. Things become worse as Gintoki is stuck with this sword up his behind, the sword's wife is in the care of one Okita Sougo and a serial killer wields the most powerful and dangerous Amanto sword... and all three end up colliding in this tale.

arcs.Name: Hasegawa Prosecution Arc
arcs.Description: Hasegawa phones Hatsu about his new job and wishes to live together again, but he hears another man and Hatsu is forced to hang up. Hasegawa gets into some trouble and is arrested...

arcs.Name: Correspondence Arc
arcs.Description: After telling the Otsu fanclub that the only girl for them is Otsu, Shinpachi receives a letter in a bottle asking him if it was fate that brought them together. What to do? Reply back!

arcs.Name: Kabukicho Stray Cat Arc
arcs.Description: A lot of wild cats are roaming the streets, so the Yorozuya is on the lookout for Kabukicho's top cat, Hoichi. While they secretly watch, Gintoki suddenly disappears without a trace...

arcs.Name: Kabukicho Four Devas Arc
arcs.Description: A girl named Pirako Chin is looking for the strongest man in the Kabuki district, and came to Gintoki to join the Yorozuya. The Yorozuya were hesitant to recruit her, especially after learning that she was a bloodthirsty gangster who wants to help Gintoki rule the Kabuki District.

arcs.Name: Patriot Reunion Party Arc
arcs.Description: Sakata Gintoki was late to the reunion party of the Joui Patriots, and was ridiculed by Sakamoto Tatsuma and Katsura Kotarou as a result. Annoyed, he wanted to leave, but was stopped by the two.

arcs.Name: Afro Arc
arcs.Description: As Katsura tries to infiltrate the Shinsengumi, he ends up under the command of the silent and dangerous Saitou Shimaru. Shimaru requests the Yorozuya to help him overcome his shyness to befriend the disguised Katsura. Unfortunately everything goes downhill as Katsura manipulates the Shinsengumi into arresting Shimaru and it is up to the Yorozuya to save the silent man and expose Katsura.

arcs.Name: Fuyo Arc
arcs.Description: Fuyo Arc is the 14th arc in Gintama. This arc introduces Tama.

arcs.Name: Monkey Hunter Arc
arcs.Description: The TV's talking about alien abduction and Shinpachi finds out that he's a victim. Recalling that the aliens were fans of a PSP game, they're off to find them!

arcs.Name: Character Poll Arc
arcs.Description: After the second character popularity poll is released, Shinpachi sits alone in a restaurant bemoaning his placing in 8th. Yamazaki approaches him from behind and consoles him by saying that characters like them are like the dirt - plain, and unnoticed, but they help beautiful flowers bloom. Soon afterwards, Yamazaki is stripped naked and beaten by an unknown villain. The humiliation causes Yamazaki's ranking to drop drastically, warning Shinpachi of an unknown villain who is trying to reach the top of the character polls by taking out everybody above him.

arcs.Name: Love Choriss Arc
arcs.Description: Did Shinpachi finally score a girlfriend? Or did Shinpachi walk into a dream that he needs to be awakened out of?

arcs.Name: Soul Switch Arc
arcs.Description: Gintoki and Hijikata simultaneously get into an accident, switching their souls in the process. Until they find a way to change back, what fate lies in store for the Yorozuya and the Shinsengumi, the organizations they lead...!?

arcs.Name: HDZ48 Arc
arcs.Description: Kagura and Otsu start up a full-scale idol unit. In response, the galaxy's strongest idol group sends them a challenge. And at the dueling stage, Diamond Perfume (Diamond Vacuum in anime) participates as a backup band too!?

arcs.Name: Guardian Dog Arc
arcs.Description: A yakuza group asks the Yorozuya to get the boss' son out of the warehouse where he has been hiding for years. Yet there is more going on than meets the eye which involves the boss' right-hand man.

arcs.Name: Santa Arc
arcs.Description: Kagura writes a letter to her father and also ends up asking why Santa never visits. Umibozu takes some time off to surprise her as Santa, but he isn't the only one!

arcs.Name: Scandal Arc
arcs.Description: "Let's drink away the year's woes at the Year-End party!" The next morning, Gin-san wakes up with a hangover and finds himself in a... strange bedroom... Has Gin-san made an error in a single night with 6 familiar faces!? An unprecedented scandal comes to light.

arcs.Name: Farewell, Shinsengumi Arc
arcs.Description: Days after Shige Shige's funeral, Nobu Nobu continues consolidating his power after his three months as shogun. He starts by arresting Matsudaira and Kondou for failing to protect the former shogun and sentencing them to death. He then disbands the Shinsengumi. With nothing left to lose, Hijikata, Okita, and the officers team up with Katsura and his Joui faction plus the Yorozuya to save Kondou, Matsudaira and the later captured Katsura from death. While some could foresee Isaburo and his Mimawarigumi arriving to hinder them, few could foresee the arrival of the Naraku...and a Tendoushuu member.

arcs.Name: Infant Strife Arc
arcs.Description: Infant Strife Arc is the eighth arc in Gintama. It introduces Okada Nizou.

arcs.Name: Barber Arc
arcs.Description: Barber Arc

arcs.Name: Jugem Arc
arcs.Description: The Yagyu family is ordered to train a mischievous pet monkey for the shogun's relative. But there's one problem first: the monkey doesn't seem to have a name yet.

arcs.Name: Kaientai Arc
arcs.Description: During a business meeting of the Kaientai, Sakamoto introduced a bag containing 50 million yen as his latest product. In fact, it was an ordinary bag having nothing but rocks inside. Later, he used these bags to throw a party at Snack Smile to impress Oryou. Under Gintoki's instruction, Mutsu arrived and angrily threw him into the ocean in a bag.

arcs.Name: Yoshiwara in Flames Arc
arcs.Description: Yoshiwara is an underground red-light district governed by different laws. Gintoki bumps into a pickpocketing kid that needs money to buy a woman who he believes to be his mother...

arcs.Name: Hardboiled Detective Arc
arcs.Description: A detective (who considers himself "hardboiled") and his apprentice have been trying to catch an elusive thief for a long time. Here comes the Yorozuya to help!

arcs.Name: Homeless Arc
arcs.Description: Ikumatsu, shopkeeper of the Hokuto Shinken, continues to wait for a certain customer to fulfill a promise she made with her husband. After her husband's passing and the customer's disappearance, Katsura and Gin-san look for him, learning of his unexpected identity!

arcs.Name: Ryugujo Arc
arcs.Description: Yorozuya went to the beach with the mission to catch a suspicious person, however, they started to look at chicks with their binoculars. Kagura caught Kamenashi videotaping girls in their swimsuit and proceeded to beat him up. They agreed on not to take Kamenashi to the police as he would take them to Ryugu Palace.

arcs.Name: Thorny Arc
arcs.Description: A dim-witted boy in a noble family was sent to the Shinsengumi to be looked after and became Hijikata's page. Though, behind the Shinsengumi, the boy's half-brother, the chief of Mimawarigumi, was surely up to something..

arcs.Name: Shogun Assassination Arc
arcs.Description: Shige Shige finds himself a target for assassination from Nobu Nobu and his allies, the Kiheitai and the Harusame. To protect him, Matsudaira forms a plan to secretly smuggle him to Kyou, with the help of the Oniwabanshuu, Shinsengumi and the Yorozuya. They must contend with enemy ninja, one of the strongest terrorist groups, and one of the strongest Amanto races to save the Shogun. But will that be enough? Plus the long-awaited battle between Gintoki and Takasugi happens here.

arcs.Name: Shinsengumi Death Game Arc
arcs.Description: Hijikata and Sogo wake up to find out they're involved in a game where they have 72 hours to decide: sacrifice the other to save the Shinsengumi HQ from a bomb or let it explode?

arcs.Name: Glasses Arc
arcs.Description: As Gintoki noted that their house had a new TV, Kagura explained that it was sent to them. However, the TV turned out to be a box with Ayame inside. Gintoki ended up telling Sadaharu to turn off the TV, which he did by biting her head. As a result, her glasses were broken during the struggle, and, instead of buying a new pair of glasses for her, Gintoki gave her the glasses of the optical shop's owner. Ayame was somewhat obsessed with the new glasses, taking care of them as a person (to the point of going into a love hotel with the glasses.) While so, Gintoki had Gengai repaired her glasses, but she refused to use them when they were returned.

arcs.Name: Yagyu Arc
arcs.Description: Yagyuu Arc is the 11th arc in Gintama. It introduces Kyuubei, Kyuubei's family and the family's retainers.

arcs.Name: Otsu Arc
arcs.Description: Otsu announces a competition to be her official fanclub, and at the same time Shinpachi's members are leaving for another fanclub. The rivaling fanclub appears to be lead by... Toshi?

arcs.Name: Red Spider Arc
arcs.Description: A mysterious man called Jiraia comes to plan a terrorist attack toward the Edo tower and bring down Yoshiwara. This man hides a dark past about his ninja life during the 13th shogun's regime.

arcs.Name: Rakuyou Decisive Battle Arc
arcs.Description: Weeks after the Shinsengumi leave Edo, the Yorozuya and Katsura's Jouishishi have been in hiding since then. A request from Imai Nobume leads to the two groups teaming up with the remnant Kiheitai plus Sakamoto and his Kaientai to save Kamui and Takasugi from the deadly clutches of Utsuro and his Harusame. Things become more complicated when Utsuro also sets his sights on Umibouzu, who is also after Kamui. All these groups will come together and fight to survive on the Rakuyou.

arcs.Name: Timeskip Arc
arcs.Description: After the Gintama series ended its one-week hiatus, Shinpachi went back to work and found out that 2 years had passed, and everyone around him had changed drastically;

arcs.Name: Dekoboko Arc
arcs.Description: A fortuneteller on the roadside talks to Kyubei about her worries to live as a man or a woman. After a sudden flash of light in the sky, all the citizens of Kabukicho swapped... genders!?

arcs.Name: Courtesan of a Nation Arc
arcs.Description: Gintoki was invited to Yoshiwara to meet Suzuran, Yoshiwara's most beautiful courtesan, to thank him personally for saving Yoshiwara. Gintoki's excitement to see Suzuran was blown away after seeing Suzuran as an old lady, shocked to find she's still working as a prostitute even in an old age. He soon learns that Suzuran was still waiting to see someone, a person she loved who made a promise to see her in the next full moon, wrapping each other's pinkie with a strand of hair, and Suzuran mistook Gintoki for the man and wrapped her strand of hair in his pinkie. Gintoki and Tsukuyo eventually decide to help Suzuran find that man (Gintoki teased Tsukuyo for doing the so, defending she wanted the man killed).

arcs.Name: Kintaro Arc
arcs.Description: Sadaharu was feeling odd so Kagura convinced Gintoki to take him to a veterinary. While examining his inside the doctor tells the Yorozuya trio that Sadaharu must have eaten something. A shadow of a hand is shown on the monitor. Gintoki and Shinpachi think Sadaharu had eaten a human and tried to escape but Sadaharu vomited out a human hand. Kagura pulls and it turns out to be a human-sized doll. Gintoki and Shinpachi, looking very pale, took the doll and went home, making Kagura think if they are sick. Katsura appeared and started to talk with Kagura. He said that he came here to show Elizabeth to a doctor. Suddenly, they heard a doctor talking with someone about a dying dog and its dying master.

arcs.Name: Owee Arc
arcs.Description: The OWee game console is releasing and the line-ups are huge. The Yorozuya and the Shinsengumi have their own reasons for buying one, but stocks are limited.

arcs.Name: Confessional Arc
arcs.Description: When Otose’s customers begin to ask for advice from Tama, Gintoki decides to make an anonymous confession booth and make money out of it. The first to visit was Shinpachi, who confesses to destroying the precious model figure belonging to his boss, by throwing a mop. Shinpachi continues to insult his boss, describing him as a terrible, lazy person who never pays him. Gintoki, observing from behind the confession booth, doesn’t realize the anonymous customer was Shinpachi and unknowingly joins in to insult the lazy and cheap boss.

arcs.Name: Okita Mitsuba Arc
arcs.Description: Mitsuba, Sougo’s older sister, pays a visit to the Shinsengumi headquarters to announce her marriage. The squad members are shocked to see Sougo’s change in attitude when in front of Mitsuba. The two spend some time together for the first time in years. Mitsuba, who has always looked after her younger brother since he was little, is worried if Sougo is doing fine in the Shinsengumi. Sougo comments that he's fine and has made friends and Mitsuba reveals she is getting married to a businessman who later revealed to be an evil man who is only using her for his business and to win the Shinsegumis support through Sougo. Mitsuba has a serious pulmonary disease and she gets worse when she saw Hijikata, and is taken to the hospital. Shortly after realizing her fiance's true intentions, Hijikata decides to kill him himself and receives backup after almost being killed due to their numbers. After Mitsuba's fiance is killed by the combined effort of Sougo and Hijikata, Mitsuba spends her last moments telling Sougo how proud she is of having him as a brother while Sougo mourns over her death. Hijikata is seen on the hospital rooftop eating spicy rice crackers, a tribute to Mitsuba's favorite food, and crying over her death.

arcs.Name: Silver Soul Arc
arcs.Description: Utsuro's ultimate plan is revealed: spark a universal war that will ultimately lead to the destruction of Earth, allowing him to finally die but taking the universe down with him. Gintoki and others must team up with old allies and former enemies to not only defeat him but also the victims of the immortal's plans, a gathering army of vengeful Amanto who may no longer listen to reason...

arcs.Name: Beam Sword Style Arc
arcs.Description: Moving towards reviving the dojo that her father left behind, Otae reunites with a former instructor who had previously gone missing. But is this person, who mastered a new sci-fi sword style, hiding an enormous secret that can affect the Earth's existence!?

arcs.Name: Renho Arc
arcs.Description: A message saying "Please don't look for me" was left behind in Elizabeth's room. Katsura and Gintoki work together, but the mystery around Elizabeth's origin only continues to thicken...

arcs.Name: Ghost Ryokan Arc
arcs.Description: Otose gives the gang a break and sends them to the mountains to enjoy an inn that belongs to an old friend. But isn't it a little... haunted? And the bus isn't coming back anytime soon...

arcs.Name: Kintama Arc
arcs.Description: Gintoki's Identity has been stolen by Kintoki, an android made by Gengai as an assistant for Shinpachi and Kagura since Gin is always ditching them. Kintoki essentially becomes a perfect replacement of Gin. Everyone has come to adore the new Yoroyuza boss, whilst seemingly forgetting Gintoki...
